title: Ticket #103: Build/Test web pages: Clean up design
description:
The current design for the Condor build/test web pages is garish and busy. It's so busy that it's easy to overlook information, and it's a bit of an eyestrain. Reconsider the design and see if we can improve it.

A few possible improvements, using this page as an example:

  • The individual result cells have sub-tables with their own frames, creating a noisy double-frame effect. Remove the inner frame.
  • The individual result cells have sub-tables with their dividing lines. Do we need those lines for a little 3x2 table?
  • Do we need to screen success in such a bold green? Maybe mute it to a faint green. Maybe just the page's background color? The same goes for individual pages like this one; the existance of a "0" in the cell may be enough to distinguish between "success" and "no result at all", both of which are considered acceptable.
  • Again looking at this one, do individual result numbers need to be bold? Perhaps only bold failures?
